Line 30: Line 30:
===Humble Indie Bundle #3===
===Humble Indie Bundle #3===
â
The fourth Humble Bundle, but the third carrying the Indie title, was launched on July 26, 2011, featuring a new set of five games from independent developers. The fourth bundle included ''[[Crayon Physics Deluxe]]'' ([[Kloonigames]]), ''[http://www.cogsgame.com/ Cogs]'' (Lazy 8 Studios), ''[[VVVVVV]]'' (Terry Cavanagh), ''[[Hammerfight]]'' (Kranx Productions), and ''[[And Yet It Moves]]'' (Broken Rules). Charitable donations continued to go towards [[Child's Play]] and the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]. Within 17 hours, the Bundle had broken $500k in total sales with over 107,000 bundles purchased, a significant improvement relative to the Frozenbyte bundle.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/36120/Third_Humble_Indie_Bundle_See_105K_Downloads_500K_Sales_In_17_Hours.php | title = Third Humble Indie Bundle See 105K Downloads, $500K Sales In 17 Hours | first = Mike | last = Rose | date= 2011-07-27 | accessdate =2011-07-27 | publisher = [[Gamasutra]] }}</ref> The bundle also allowed purchasers to play ''[[Minecraft]]'' until August 14, 2011.<ref>https://twitter.com/#!/humble/status/96722930578362368</ref>
+
The fourth Humble Bundle, but the third carrying the Indie title, was launched on July 26, 2011, featuring a new set of five games from independent developers. The fourth bundle included ''[[Crayon Physics Deluxe]]'' ([[Kloonigames]]), ''[[Cogs (video game)|Cogs]]'' (Lazy 8 Studios), ''[[VVVVVV]]'' (Terry Cavanagh), ''[[Hammerfight]]'' (Kranx Productions), and ''[[And Yet It Moves]]'' (Broken Rules). Charitable donations continued to go towards [[Child's Play]] and the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]. Within 17 hours, the Bundle had broken $500k in total sales with over 107,000 bundles purchased, a significant improvement relative to the Frozenbyte bundle.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/36120/Third_Humble_Indie_Bundle_See_105K_Downloads_500K_Sales_In_17_Hours.php | title = Third Humble Indie Bundle See 105K Downloads, $500K Sales In 17 Hours | first = Mike | last = Rose | date= 2011-07-27 | accessdate =2011-07-27 | publisher = [[Gamasutra]] }}</ref> The bundle also allowed purchasers to play ''[[Minecraft]]'' until August 14, 2011.<ref>https://twitter.com/#!/humble/status/96722930578362368</ref>
